title: 'PM Modi had intel, security forces not informed': Kharge's big claim on Pahalgam
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of withholding intelligence about the impending terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir. Kharge linked the postponement of PM Modi's Srinagar visit to the attack, questioning why the intelligence wasn't shared with security forces. He criticized the government for alleged intelligence failure and inadequate security for tourists following the attack.

title: Woman BJP leader beheaded in Tamil Nadu; police deny political motive
content: A BJP functionary, B Saranya, was murdered and beheaded near Thanjavur, with her stepson and two others surrendering to police. Authorities deny political motives, attributing the crime to a family dispute over property. Saranya had previously been arrested for throwing footwear at a minister's car in 2022, but police maintain the murder stemmed from internal conflict.

title: 'Pakistan thought they had advantage but ...': Tharoor on closed-door UNSC meet
content: Shashi Tharoor stated that Pakistan faced tough questions regarding terrorism and Lashkar-e-Taiba at a recent UNSC closed-door meeting following the Pahalgam attack. Despite Pakistan's attempt to raise the issue, member countries focused on LeT's role and the threat of terrorism. Tharoor anticipates a general call for peace but no specific resolutions due to potential vetoes from China.

title: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee visits riot-hit Murshidabad
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee visited Murshidabad after communal clashes. She met with victim families in Samserganj. Banerjee assured full government support and strict action against those responsible for the violence. The clashes occurred during protests against the Waqf Amendment Act. Banerjee blamed vested interests for inciting unrest. Heavy security was present during her visit to the district.

title: Warren Buffet: I am somewhat embarrassed to say Apple CEO Tim Cook ...
content: Warren Buffett, the legendary investor, acknowledged Tim Cook's role in Berkshire Hathaway's success. He credited Apple's CEO for significant financial gains. Buffett announced his retirement at the annual meeting. This marked the end of an era. Greg Abel, the vice chairman, is set to succeed Buffett. Abel will lead Berkshire with a focus on long-term value.

title: Virat Kohli on stepping down from captaincy: 'I needed to be happy'
content: Virat Kohli revealed he stepped down from captaincy roles for India and RCB due to immense pressure. He sought mental peace and happiness. Kohli felt overwhelmed by expectations and constant scrutiny. He took a break in 2022 to rediscover his love for the game. MS Dhoni and Gary Kirsten supported his early career.

title: TCS gives 100% quarterly variable pay to 70% staff; remaining workforce sees lower numbers
content: Tata Consultancy Services distributed 100% quarterly variable compensation to 70% of its employees, while the remainder received reduced payouts based on their business unit's performance.

title: Rape survivor, 5, made to wait 10 hours for medical test in UP
content: Pilibhit district women's hospital faced scrutiny after a rape survivor waited long for medical examination. UP government intervened, directing Autonomous State Medical College doctors to handle medico-legal cases. A duty roster will be created. DNA samples were also found improperly stored. An abduction victim was referred to a distant facility despite available doctors.

title: CEOs Microsoft, Adobe, IBM, Cognizant and others warn US is falling behind
content: Top CEOs, including Microsoft's Satya Nadella, are urging the U.S. to mandate computer science and AI education in K-12 schools. They warn that America is lagging behind countries like China and Singapore. The leaders emphasize that a single computer science course could boost wages by 8% and unlock significant economic potential.

title: Delhi University asks colleges to collect personal data of Kashmiri students
content: Delhi University's directive to collect personal data, including Aadhaar numbers and addresses, from Kashmiri students has sparked concerns about privacy and potential profiling. The university claims the order originates from the Ministry of Home Affairs, aiming to ensure the safety of students following reports of harassment.

title: As Israel blocks aid, 'reality in Gaza is indescribable'
content: Gazans face dire conditions after 19 months of war. An Israeli blockade exacerbates shortages of food, medicine, and fuel. Prices of basic goods have skyrocketed. People are burning clothes for cooking. Airstrikes and attacks leave no safe place. The healthcare system is near collapse. Aid organizations have depleted supplies. Displaced families struggle to survive amid constant fear and uncertainty.

title: Pakistan stock market drops around 4% but India’s Sensex is up 1.5%
content: Following the April 22, 2025, terrorist attack in Jammu & Kashmir, tensions between India and Pakistan have escalated, impacting financial markets. Pakistan's KSE-100 index has declined by approximately 4%, while India's Sensex has gained 1.5%, reflecting differing economic resilience.

title: Ray Dalio, the man who predicted 2008 recession, says Trump Tariff pushing US to recession
content: Ray Dalio, who predicted the 2008 crisis, warns that mishandled economic policies, particularly Trump's tariffs, could push the U.S. into a recession. He likens the tariffs' disruptive implementation to destabilizing the production system. Despite a tariff pause, Goldman Sachs estimates a significant chance of a recession within the next year, highlighting growing economic uncertainty.

title: One murdered, another injured following clash over cricket match in Bhadravati
content: Superintendent of Police G.K. Mithun Kumar informed the media that the police had secured two persons in connection with the incident

title: Officials in Jammu review plan to enhance facilities for Amarnath Yatra
content: Jammu officials plan new and revised measures to improve civic facilities for the upcoming Amarnath Yatra

title: Notify local body elections in Maharashtra: Supreme Court to State poll panel
content: Supreme Court directs Maharashtra SEC to notify local body elections within four weeks; OBC reservation to remain unchanged

title: Kerala Plus One application submission from May 14
content: First three allotments will be published by June 16 and Plus One higher secondary classes will begin on June 18

title: Government notifies cashless treatment scheme for road accident victims nationwide
content: Any person being a victim of a road accident arising out of the use of a motor vehicle, occurring on any road, shall be entitled to cashless treatment in accordance with the provisions of this scheme

title: Madras High Court quashes election bribery case booked against Vedasandur DMK MLA
content: Justice GK Ilanthiraiyan says, police must have obtained judicial magistrate’s permission before registering FIR for non cognisable offence

title: Pahalgam attack | Crackdown to nab terrorists should not target entire people of Kashmir, says CM Omar Abdullah
content: The Chief Minister condemned the Kulgam incident, in which a 23-year-old youth Imtiyaz Ahmad Magray died during a search operation

title: E.P. Jayarajan to release autobiography next month, ends legal row with DC Books
content: Jayarajan confirms speaking to the publisher verbally and says ‘having acknowledged the mistake, I see no merit in pursuing further legal action’

title: MGNREGA awareness campaign in all gram panchayats of Belagavi district
content: The aim is to ensure that all registered unskilled labourers get work for 100 days so that the trend of summer migration is reduced

title: Opinion: Opinion | There's A Caveat In Pak's Suspension Of Simla Pact
content: The Simla agreement's disregard not only threatens the concept of "limited war" but also deepens the trust deficit, eroding even the appearance of cooperation.

title: Understanding Mega Security Drill: How Towns Black Out To Prep For Air Raids
content: India is gearing up for a nationwide security drill tomorrow amid heightened tension with Pakistan in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack that left 26 innocents dead

title: "Pak Thought They Had Advantage But...": Shashi Tharoor Decodes UN Talks
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, a former diplomat who has served at the United Nations, has pointed out the "sad reality" of Security Council consultations after its members met last night to discuss the India-Pakistan tensions and Pahalgam attack.

title: Marijuana Use During Pregnancy Dangerous For Fetus, New Study Reveals
content: Using marijuana during pregnancy can increase the odds of preterm birth, low birth weight, poor fetal development and even infant death, a new study has warned.

title: With Lower Oil Prices, Russia, Ukraine Want To Settle: Trump
content: US President Donald Trump said Moscow and Kyiv want to settle the war in Ukraine and that Russian President Vladimir Putin was more inclined towards peace after the recent fall in the price of oil.

title: Poor Crew Management Among Reasons Behind Death On SpiceJet Flight: Report
content: Three years after turbulence in a SpiceJet flight resulted in the death of a passenger and injuries to many others, a probe has concluded that poor crew resource management were among the probable causes for the accident.

title: What Is A Security Drill And What To Expect On May 7
content: A mock drill lets people rehearse what to do in a safe and controlled way, so they are ready if a real crisis happens.

title: US Woman Reveals How Boyfriend Killed Daughter, Stuffed Body Inside Drawer
content: Two years after a toddler's body was found inside a hidden dresser drawer at an abandoned home in Indiana, the child's mother has pleaded guilty to two charges.

title: 480 Workers, 90 Days: How Indian Brand Crafted Met Gala Carpet For 3rd Time
content: Neytt, based out of Kerala's Alappuzha, was behind the creation of the 63,000-square-foot eco-friendly blue carpet.

title: Adani Power Wins Contract To Supply 1,500 MW Electricity To UP
content: Adani Power has won a contract to supply 1,500 megawatts of electricity to Uttar Pradesh at Rs 5.38 per unit for 25 years, sources said.

title: India Pak Tensions Live Updates: Pakistan Man Caught Near Line Of Control In J&K
content: India Pakistan Tensions LIVE Updates: Cross-border firing from the Pakistani side continued for the 12th straight night along the Line of Control.

title: Delhi Bound Air India Flight Diverted Due To Clogged Toilets On May 2
content: An Air India flight from Toronto to the national capital was diverted to Frankfurt on May 2 due to clogged lavatories, according to sources.

title: Asaduddin Owaisi Calls For "Effective" Response To Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday said India should give an effective response to last month's Pahalgam attack and termed the incident as barbaric and cowardly.

title: "Not Riots, We Want Peace": Mamata Banerjee In Violence-Hit Murshidabad
content: Mamata Banerjee visited the riot-affected areas of Murshidabad district and met the families of those affected in last month's communal clashes.

title: Nationwide Cashless Treatment Scheme For Road Accident Victims: Centre
content: The government has notified cashless treatment scheme for road accident victims nationwide, under which they will be entitled to a maximum amount of Rs 1.5 lakh per accident per person.

title: Vatican To Cut Phone Signal During Conclave To Elect New Pope
content: The Vatican said Monday it would cut the phone signal within the tiny city state during the conclave to elect a new pope -- but this would not affect St Peter's Square.

title: India's Only Woman Rafale Fighter Pilot Is Now Eyeing Space
content: The excited little girl who first touched a plane two decades ago is now flying high as the face of India's fast-modernising military and its only woman Rafale fighter pilot.

title: Cardinals To Move Into Vatican On Eve Of Conclave, Will Elect New Pope
content: Cardinals will on Tuesday begin moving into the Vatican accommodation where they will stay during the conclave, on the eve of their historic, secretive meeting to elect a new pope.

title: Who is Ilhan Omar? And why is she so controversial?
content: Ilhan Omar, a prominent and polarizing figure in American politics, faces renewed scrutiny after a resurfaced clip sparked accusations of promoting profiling. She defended her remarks citing data on white supremacist extremism. This controversy follows criticism for her response to a reporter and persistent, debunked rumors about her personal life.

title: ‘Used to carry lights at weddings’: UP teen first to clear Class 10 exam in village
content: In a Barabanki village, Ramkeval, a 15-year-old from the Dalit community, has become the first person to pass the class 10 board exams. He supported his family by carrying lights in wedding processions. District Magistrate Shashank Tripathi honored Ramkeval and his parents, assuring support for his future studies.

title: Man crashes through gates of Jennifer Aniston’s Bel-Air home while she is inside
content: A man in his 70s was arrested on Monday after crashing his car into Jennifer Aniston's Bel-Air home. The incident occurred around noon, prompting Aniston's security to detain the man at gunpoint until police arrived. While Aniston was unharmed, the suspect faces felony property damage charges. Authorities are investigating his motives, with no current indication of a targeted attack.

title: Nationwide civil defence mock drill on May 7: All you need to know
content: Mock Drill in India: Following the Pahalgam terror attack and rising security concerns, the ministry of home affairs will conduct a nationwide civil defence mock drill across 244 districts on May 7. The exercise aims to enhance emergency preparedness and public safety mechanisms by training civilians and testing critical infrastructure. Union home secretary Govind Mohan will review preparations with key officials.

title: AI Toronto-Delhi flight diverted to Frankfurt due to clogged toilets
content: An Air India flight from Toronto to Delhi was diverted to Frankfurt due to blocked toilets, marking the second such incident in two months. The airline cited a technical fault, but sources revealed non-functional toilets as the cause.

title: 'Give me a break': Trump brushes off Catholic backlash over AI Pope image
content: Donald Trump dismissed criticism over an AI-generated image depicting him as the Pope, attributing the backlash to the “fake news media.” The image, shared on Truth Social and reposted by the White House X account, sparked outrage among Catholic groups and Italian commentators, who deemed it disrespectful.

title: Surprise and Shock as ChatGPT maker takes HUGE U-Turn: It is Elon Musk or ...
content: In a surprising turn, ChatGPT creator OpenAI will remain under nonprofit control, reversing plans for a for-profit transition. This decision follows internal debates, scrutiny from Microsoft and Elon Musk, and concerns raised by authorities. Microsoft, a major investor, reportedly sought greater control, while Musk sued OpenAI, alleging abandonment of its original mission.

title: IPL playoffs scenarios: With 15 matches to go, MI have 75% chance of progressing
content: With 15 IPL 2025 league stage games remaining, RCB, GT, and PBKS are almost certain for the playoffs, while MI is a strong contender. DC has a fair chance, but LSG and KKR face slim odds. Probabilities are calculated based on 32,768 possible result combinations, assessing each team's chances of finishing in the top four and top two.

title: Pakistani national detained near LoC in Poonch sector
content: The Indian Army apprehended a Pakistani national near the Line of Control in the Poonch sector of Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday, officials confirmed. This apprehension has heightened alertness among security forces, especially after the recent terror attack in Pahalgam, which resulted in 28 fatalities. Security forces have intensified surveillance and patrolling in the region to prevent further infiltration attempts.

title: Virat Kohli–Rahul Vaidya row: What's happening?
content: IPL 2025 is witnessing off-field drama as singer Rahul Vaidya mocks Virat Kohli over a social media 'like' incident involving influencer Avneet Kaur. Kohli blamed Instagram's algorithm, leading to Vaidya's sarcastic response and alleged blocking. This sparked a fan backlash, with Vaidya hitting back, criticizing Kohli's fans and questioning Kohli's character, escalating the situation into a full-blown social media feud.

title: Maoists kill deputy sarpanch in Sukma; 9th civilian murder in Bastar this year
content: Maoists killed Muchaki Rama, the deputy sarpanch of Tarlaguda village panchayat, in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district on Monday. Armed Maoists abducted Rama from his residence in Benpalli village, later his body was discovered. This incident marks the ninth civilian death attributed to Maoists in the Bastar region this year.

title: Did co-passengers provoke Delhi Thar driver to run over security guard?
content: In Delhi, a security guard named Rajiv Kumar was intentionally run over by a Mahindra Thar after objecting to incessant honking. The driver, Vijay alias Lale, has been arrested, and the vehicle seized. Kumar suffered multiple fractures and is the sole provider for his family, now facing financial hardship due to his injuries and inability to work.

title: Germany's Friedrich Merz falls short of majority in first vote to become chancellor
content: Friedrich Merz's bid to become Germany's next chancellor faced a setback as he failed to secure a majority in the Bundestag's initial vote, falling six votes short of the required 316. Despite a pre-approved coalition deal, some lawmakers defected, leaving the outcome uncertain.

title: Did Ilhan Omar marry her own brother?
content: The claim dates back to 2016, first floated on a Somali-American internet forum. It alleges that Omar’s 2009 marriage to British citizen Ahmed Nur Said Elmi was not only a sham—but that Elmi was, in fact, her biological brother. The motive, according to the theory, was to secure a path to US citizenship for him.

title: 'US will support important partner India's efforts against terrorism'
content: US House Speaker Mike Johnson affirmed unwavering support for India's counter-terrorism efforts, emphasizing the nation's crucial partnership. This commitment follows the Pahalgam attack, where Pakistan-backed terrorists killed tourists. Johnson believes the Trump administration would increase resources to address threats against India.

title: Pahalgam fallout: India makes Chenab run dry, for now
content: Following a terror attack and the suspension of the Indus Water Treaty, India has restricted water flow from the Baglihar and Salal dams on the Chenab River. This unprecedented action led to dramatically low water levels, allowing residents to walk across the riverbed for the first time in memory. The move highlights India's ability to regulate water resources and has sparked debate over the treaty's impact on the region.

title: ‘Sorry Karnataka’: Sonu Nigam apologises after 'Kannada remarks’ at Bengaluru event
content: Singer Sonu Nigam has publicly apologized to Karnataka's people following an FIR against him for allegedly making derogatory remarks about the Kannadiga community during a Bengaluru music event. The apology, which Sonu Nigam posted on Instagram, came after police issued a notice requiring the singer to appear for an investigation.

title: MP board 12th result: Priyal Dwivedi tops, check stream wise result
content: The Madhya Pradesh Board of Secondary Education has announced the class 12th board exam results, showcasing a pass percentage of 74.48%. Priyal Dwivedi topped the state in Science (Maths group) with 492/500. Gargi Agarwal and Divyanshu Tiwari secured the top position in Science (Biology).

title: Supreme Court pulls up Punjab for ‘high-handedness’ in denotifying land meant for SYL canal
content: A Constitution Bench had, in 2016, set aside the Punjab Termination of Agreement Act, 2004 which had “unilaterally” terminated the 1981 water-sharing pact between Punjab, Haryana and Rajasthan

title: LDF govt committed to building a ‘Nava Keralam’, says Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Pinarayi says even when the State ‘did not receive support’ from Union government, Kerala was able to move forward

title: Opposition formed opportunistic alliance out of frustration of repeated failures: DMK president Stalin
content: Elaborate election strategies will be discussed during the party’s general council meeting scheduled to be held in Madurai on June 1, said the DMK president

title: Union Carbide waste disposal: Incineration starts at Pithampur plant
content: After burning all the garbage, the remaining ash will be disposed of safely so that it does not harm the environment, the official said

title: States told to make prison infrastructure accessible to inmates with  disabilities
content: Redesign prisons to protect and promote rights of all inmates, including those with disabilities: MHA

title: Bengaluru sweet shop staffer arrested for recording video of woman in washroom
content: The 25-year-old victim had gone to Anand Sweets on Koramangala 60 feet road to use the washroom at around 8 pm on April 25

title: Supreme Court rejects convicts’ plea against two-judge Bench hearing Godhra train burning appeals
content: A Constitution Bench of the Supreme Court had held that in all cases in which death sentence was awarded by the HC, such matters be listed before a Bench of three Judges

title: India's services sector growth improves slightly in April on new order inflows
content: The seasonally adjusted HSBC India Services PMI Business Activity Index reached 58.7 in April, up from 58.5 in March, indicating a sharp and stronger expansion in service sector output

title: Catholic Church denies recommending any name for KPCC president post
content: In an editorial in Deepika, official mouthpiece of Catholic Church in Kerala, the institution strongly refutes claim it sought any political favours or attempted to influence party appointments

title: Doddabetta Peak closed for tourists after wild elephant enters reserve forest area near Ooty
content: Forty forest department personnel are involved in efforts to monitor the animal, with two thermal drones also being used to keep tabs on it.

title: Three killed in lightning strikes amid unseasonal rains in Marathwada
content: Three killed in lightning strikes during unseasonal rains in Marathwada, with additional cattle casualties reported in nearby districts

title: M.P. Board result 2025: 76% clear Class 10, 74% Class 12; girls emerge topper
content: According to official data, 144 out of 212 students in the Class 10 merit list are girls. Similarly, 89 out of 159 students in the Class 12 merit list are girls this year

title: Tamil Nadu Class 12 Board exam results on May 8
content: The results will be released by the Minister of School Education Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi at 9 a.m. in Chennai

title: Suvendu Adhikari to move Calcutta High Court for extension of Central Force deployment in violence-hit Murshidabad
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party leader claimed that the counsels appearing for the West Bengal government in the High Court hearings since April 12 have consistently opposed the deployment of Central forces as well as the extension of their stay in Murshidabad.

title: IPO market loses steam on global market jitters
content: Uncertainty forcing many companies to delay IPOs; Some 58 firms with regulatory nod yet to go public in India; 58% slump in IPOs listed on India's main stock exchanges

title: India Leads World In Self-Reported AI Skills, Says UN Report
content: India has the highest UNDP report penetration in the world, which reflects the country's growing potential in the sector, according to a UNDP report released on Tuesday.

title: J&K State Disaster Response Force Conducts Mock Drill At Dal Lake
content: As part of the Ministry of Home Affairs' initiative for nationwide civil defence preparedness, personnel from the Jammu and Kashmir State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) conducted a mock drill at Dal Lake, Srinagar, focusing on boat capsize scenario.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO on 'friend' Warren Buffet: He represents everything that…
content: Warren Buffett, the CEO of Berkshire Hathaway, announced his retirement, set for the end of 2025, with Greg Abel succeeding him. Jamie Dimon praised Buffett's integrity and impact on American business. Bill Gates also shared his gratitude, highlighting Buffett's mentorship and transformative influence, emphasizing his enduring legacy and the company's future under Abel's leadership.

title: Moody's cuts India's 2025 GDP growth forecast to 6.3%
content: Moody's Ratings has revised India's GDP growth forecast for 2025 to 6.3% due to global policy uncertainty and trade limitations. Geopolitical friction with Pakistan and terror attacks present additional risks. While maintaining a 6.5% growth prediction for 2026, Moody's anticipates the RBI will implement rate cuts to bolster domestic economic growth.

title: Amazon is changing its salary structure, here's who the new guidelines favour
content: Amazon is revamping its compensation strategy, rewarding veteran top performers with up to 110% of their pay range for consistent excellence over four years. First-time high achievers and those with fluctuating performance will see reduced payouts.

title: 2,000 year-old Pompeii dig reveals giraffe bone, rare glassified human brain
content: The eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD buried Pompeii and Herculaneum, preserving Roman life in ash. Recent discoveries, including exotic animal bones, vitrified brains, erotic art, and children's graffiti, offer insights into Roman cuisine, trade, medicine, and culture. Ongoing excavations continue to reveal tragic stories and expand our understanding of this ancient civilization.

title: Gautami Kapoor reveals wanting to gift her 16-yr-old daughter a pleasure toy
content: Gautami Kapoor considered gifting her daughter, Sia, a sex toy for her 16th birthday, aiming to empower her with open exploration and break from traditional parenting. While Sia was initially shocked, she now appreciates her mother's progressive thought. Kapoor's anecdote sparks conversation about motherhood, societal expectations, and a desire for her daughter to experience life's pleasures fully.

title: DC keep slipping after MI game; face uphill task of playoff qualification
content: Delhi Capitals' promising IPL 2025 campaign faces derailment after a shocking loss to Mumbai Indians triggered a slump. Once poised for playoffs, DC now struggles, sitting fifth with 13 points. Experts Piyush Chawla and Sanjay Bangar emphasise the need for bold decisions and experienced players to step up, highlighting the team's batting order collapse.

title: Man caught transporting wife's body stuffed in gunny sack on scooter in Pune
content: In Pune, a 28-year-old man was apprehended for transporting his wife's body on a scooter. Rakesh Nishar, a labourer, allegedly strangled his 26-year-old wife, Babita, after a domestic dispute at their Dhayari residence. Police intercepted Nishar in the Nanded City area early Tuesday morning, discovering the body concealed in a gunny sack

title: How much gold reserves does the RBI keep in India?
content: The Reserve Bank of India significantly reduced its gold repatriation in the second half of fiscal year 2025, bringing home only 1.53 tonnes compared to 102.15 tonnes in the previous six months. Despite this slowdown, total gold holdings reached 879.59 metric tonnes by March 2025.

title: MP girl held for recording bathing videos of girl students, sharing with boyfriend
content: A tech institute in Jabalpur is facing a scandal reminiscent of the Chandigarh 'video leak' of 2022. A second-year female student has been arrested for allegedly recording inappropriate videos of other women in the hostel bathroom and sharing them with her boyfriend in Delhi. The accused was caught in the act by a fellow student, leading to a police complaint.

title: Kamala Harris trolled for her Met Gala look: ‘Cruella did it better’
content: Kamala Harris's Met Gala debut sparked online ridicule as her black-and-cream ensemble drew comparisons to Cruella de Vil. Social media users mocked the outfit, criticizing its design and perceived disconnect from everyday Americans. The gala, themed around Black dandyism, raised millions for the Costume Institute, but Harris's appearance became an unintended punchline, fueling criticism about her being out of touch.

title: Who backed Virat Kohli to make the No. 3 spot his own for India?
content: Virat Kohli credits MS Dhoni and Gary Kirsten for backing him at No. 3, where he amassed 15,303 international runs. Kohli, who considered leaving Royal Challengers Bengaluru after a point, valued the established relationships and mutual respect over seeking a new team. He prioritised playing cricket without constant judgment, cherishing his long-term connection with RCB.

title: US court blocks Trump's bid to end legal status for 400,000 migrants
content: A federal appeals court rejected Donald Trump's effort to end temporary legal status for thousands of migrants, hindering his immigration crackdown. The court declined to suspend a previous ruling blocking the Department of Homeland Security from ending humanitarian parole granted under President Biden. Judges argued the administration failed to demonstrate the legality of categorically terminating parole, favoring individual case reviews.

title: Union Home Secretary to review preparations for civil defence mock drills
content: The measures to be taken during the mock drills include the operationalisation of air-raid warning sirens, training civilians on civil-defence aspects to protect themselves in the event of a "hostile attack"

title: Madhya Pradesh child rights body takes cognisance of 3-year-old's death after Santhara ritual
content: The child's parents, who are IT professionals, have said that they decided to make their only child observe this vow on the night of March 21 when she was very ill and was having difficulty eating and drinking

title: Supreme Court upholds 2021 Kerala Assembly poll win of Devikulam MLA
content: Kerala High Court had found A. Raja ineligible for Scheduled Caste reservation on the grounds that he was a Christian convert

title: Air India suspends Tel Aviv flights till May 8
content: The airline decided to suspend the services after its flight from Delhi to Tel Aviv was diverted to Abu Dhabi following a missile attack near the airport in the Israeli city

title: Market forces have led to change and degradation of forest ecosystems in Goa: Study
content: The authors of the study attribute this to their value being poorly understood and not considered in the policy-making process

title: Punjab Police recovers explosives, arms in joint operation targeting cross-border terror network
content: According to Punjab Police, the operation was carried out by the State Special Operation Cell (SSOC), Amritsar, based on intelligence inputs.

title: Dalit family’s hut set ablaze during communal clash in Pudukottai village, 14 arrested
content: According to police, the clash began over a verbal dispute at a petrol station between intoxicated youth from both communities.

title: Congress chief Kharge writes to PM Modi asking him to have dialogue with all political parties on caste census
content: Mallikarjun Kharge asks the Union government the follow the Telangana model, urges them to place the socio-economic data of each caste in public domain

title: Three youth drown in temple pond in Tiruvallur
content: The victims, Vedic students of Ahobila Mutt in Selaiyur, had gone to participate in the Brahmotsavam festival being celebrated in Sri Vaidhya Veeraraghava Swamy temple in Tiruvallur

title: In M.P.’s Duglai, a remote hamlet, unprecedented civic push follows a horrific crime
content: Duglai is located deep inside the forests of Balaghat, which was last month removed from the Union Home Ministry’s list of the districts “most-affected” by left-wing extremism and notified as a “district of concern”, suggesting that Maoist influence in the area is on the wane.

title: Rajasthan BJP leaders in Gujarat to attend training camp; Congress questions need
content: According to the party sources, the training sessions will cover the subjects such as the fundamentals of good governance, internal discipline and communication, public engagement strategies, understanding legislative procedures and effective dissemination of the government’s schemes.

title: YouTuber Shajan Skaria arrested on charge of telecasting ‘defamatory’ content against woman
content: The woman, currently residing abroad, had lodged the complaint against Shajan Skaria, accusing him of airing defamatory content

title: Sambhal ‘critical’ for BJP in all yardstick, says party’s organisational in-charge
content: Speaking to The Hindu, Pushkar Mishra, Organisational Election In-charge of the party said broader representation of all social segment has been the aim of the ruling party, pushing the West U.P. district as ‘critical’ for the BJP in all parameters.

title: Samyukta Maharashtra: how a linguistic movement built a State
content: Maharashtra Day has been celebrated since 1960 on May 1, along with International Labour Day. Looking back at the history of the formation of the State, one must acknowledge the contribution of Lokshahir Annabhau Sathe and Dr. B. R. Ambedkar

title: The implications of caste enumeration
content: While there is a vast political leadership who came through the lanes of OBC politics, there has also been a concentration of certain OBC communities in these spaces. The upcoming Census, with caste enumeration, could create a window of opportunity for the inclusion of those communities who have been left behind

title: Pak troops resorts to unprovoked firing along LoC in 8 sectors across J-K, Indian Army retaliates
content: Indian Army responded in a proportionate manner to the firing in areas opposite Kupwara, Baramulla, Poonch, Rajouri, Mendhar, Naushera, Sunderbani, and Akhnoor in J&K

title: Internship for undergraduate students, mandatory under NEP, remains a challenge for West Bengal colleges
content: As the National Education Policy, implemented in 2023, a student can exit college at any time — after a year, two years, or after finishing the full course — but not without doing an internship

title: BJP’s Vanathi Srinivasan flags security concerns in Coimbatore
content: Leading a protest in Coimbatore to condemn the Pahalgam attack BJP MLA Vanathi Srinivasan criticised the Tamil Nadu government’s approach to national security.

title: Russian embassy invites Naveen Patnaik to reception marking victory in Great Patriotic War
content: The embassy said, among the heroes we pay tribute to is your late father, Biju Patnaik ji, a valiant pilot of the Indian National Airways who participated in the Stalingrad Operation

title: Trading in Bitcoin in India is refined way of doing Hawala business: Supreme Court
content: A bench of Justices Surya Kant and N. Kotiswar Singh made the remarks while dealing with a bail application of Shailesh Babulal Bhatt who was arrested by the police for alleged illegal Bitcoin trade

title: Assam villagers oppose transfer of wetland grazing field for logistics park
content: The Dorabeel Village Grazing Field Protection Convening Committee said the move to hand over the land in Kamrup district to a Kolkata-based company would affect more than 3,000 families

title: Why should I face criticism for a few who indulged in riots: Mamata in Murshidabad
content: The West Bengal Chief Minister claims the Murshidabad riots were planned and promises to expose the people behind it soon

title: NHRC issues notice to Telangana govt over death of three workers in explosion at explosives plant
content: The incident took place reportedly on April 29 and the explosion caused the complete collapse of the mixing unit structure of the plant

title: As biodiversity threats mount, Forest Rights Act gives India the edge
content: At present, many international legislative institutions are recognising the crucial role indigenous peoples and local communities play in biodiversity conservation

title: Maharashtra BJP chief Bawankule urges party workers to ‘empty’ Congress, induct its leaders
content: On May 4, an audio clip of the Maharashtra BJP chief went viral, saying, ‘Bring people like Sangram Thopte into the party. Empty the Congress,’ he said while addressing local workers in a meeting held in Pune.

title: Caste census will resolve Maratha reservation issue, says Congress
content: Legislative Party leader Vijay Wadettiwar said that the Sadbhavna Yatra aims to bridge hearts and unite communities and fix the damage done by the BJP since 2014

title: Bihar polls will be the first test of the call to defeat BJP: CPI(M)‘s M.A. Baby
content: In Bihar, the party general secretary says the Mahagathbandhan alliance in the State has already begun united and serious preparations to achieve the goal

title: Odisha govt clarifies no timber from Puri’s Jagannath shrine used in Digha temple
content: A controversy has been simmering over allegations that surplus sacred timber from the Jagannath Temple in Puri was used to carve idols for the new Jagannath Temple in Digha

title: ‘Why such envy against Jagannath Temple’: Mamata Banerjee slams ‘baseless’ neem wood theft charge
content: The Bengal Chief Minister also expressed concern over reports of attacks on Bengali-speaking migrant workers in Odisha and said that they are targeted for speaking in Bengali

title: UNSC begins closed door consultations on situation between India, Pakistan
content: Hours before the closed consultations, UNSG Antonio Guterres voiced concern over tensions between the countries being at ‘their highest in years’, saying ‘it pains me to see relations reaching a boiling point’

title: Parachutes for uncrewed spaceflight of Gaganyaan mission flagged off
content: Developed indigenously by the ADRDE, the sequential system of parachutes is designed for Gaganyaan programme tests which are planned for later this year

title: India conveys concerns in ‘strongest terms’ to Canada after pro-Khalistan rally in Toronto
content: A large pro-Khalistan rally was taken out on May 4 that used terms like ‘Kill India’ and depicted several leading figures including PM Modi in a derogatory manner; the rally also raised slogans on religious lines and sought expulsion of Canadians of Indian origin

title: Detaining non-citizens and the rule of law
content: Assam’s immigration detention regime is not just a threat to the liberty and well-being of those caught up within it; it also raises important questions of constitutional principles

title: India carries out test of advanced underwater naval mine
content: The MIGM is designed to enhance the Indian Navy's capabilities against modern stealth ships and submarines

title: Miss World 2025 contestants to visit Pochampally on May 15
content: During their visit, the Miss World contestants will witness the tie-and-dye process that defines the Pochampally Ikat. T

title: Mapping process for scheduled caste communities in Karnataka focuses on ensuring ‘authenticity and accuracy’ using technology
content: After completion of the survey, the enumerators have to read out the contents and data that have been uploaded to the families, and get their consent to ensure accuracy

title: Speeding of bulletproof vehicle led to minor accident in Nadda’s convoy: T.N. Police
content: The Tamil Nadu police appeal to those travelling with VIPs not to pressure the drivers of bulletproof cars to speed

title: Delhi govt may hold meeting on May 6 to discuss preparations for mock drills
content: Measures to be taken during the drill include operationalisation of air raid warning sirens and training of civilians on civil defence aspects to protect themselves in the event of a ‘hostile attack’, govt sources said

title: 'I knew it wasn't a miss': Gordon's 3 stuns OKC
content: For the second time in these playoffs, Aaron Gordon delivered the winning shot after Denver rallied from a double-digit deficit to stun the Thunder at home in Game 1 of their Western Conference semifinal series.

title: Isles win draft lottery for first time since '09
content: The New York Islanders won the NHL draft lottery on Monday and vaulted nine teams -- including the last-place San Jose Sharks -- in winning the opportunity to have the No. 1 pick, marking the first time the franchise will have that position since 2009.

title: Celts 'bit off' as shooting woes reach historic level
content: The Celtics might've finally reached a saturation point as they missed a record 45 3-pointers Monday night as the Knicks took advantage in a 108-105 Game 1 overtime victory.

title: Williams wilts again, sees ERA top 10 as Yankee
content: New York reliever Devin Williams' nightmare season continued on Monday night with another poor outing in the Yankees' 4-3 loss to the San Diego Padres, as the right-hander was charged with three runs, increasing his ERA to 10.03 in 14 games this season.

title: Ravens make 'tough decision,' cut kicker Tucker
content: The Ravens on Monday released kicker Justin Tucker, parting ways with the NFL's most accurate kicker who is being investigated by the league for sexual misconduct.

title: Leafs goalie Stolarz exits win after elbow to head
content: In Game 1 of the Eastern Conference semifinals, Maple Leafs goaltender Anthony Stolarz exited midway through the second period of his team's 5-4 win over the Panthers on Monday, after taking an elbow to the head from Florida forward Sam Bennett.

title: Shildt, irate over Tatis ejection, throws his glasses
content: San Diego manager Mike Shildt was so angry with plate umpire Adrian Johnson that he made a spectacle by tossing his glasses en route to an ejection during the Padres' 4-3 victory over the Yankees on Monday night.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: Reshuffling all 32 teams after the draft
content: Our panel of experts ranked every NFL team from 1 to 32. Which franchises improved with their draft picks and offseason moves?

title: Who will kick for Ravens after Justin Tucker release? A look at his likely successor
content: After drafting the Arizona kicker in the sixth round, the team will likely turn to Tyler Loop after releasing Tucker on Monday.

title: Chelsea-Liverpool lessons, Napoli close to Serie A title, Bayern clinch Bundesliga, more
content: Chelsea beat Liverpool, Napoli moved closer to another Serie A title, and Bayern Munich clinched the Bundesliga without playing: Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Sources: Madrid want Alexander-Arnold for CWC
content: Real Madrid want Trent Alexander-Arnold to join them for this summer's Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN, and now plan talks with Liverpool to negotiate his early release.

title: Arteta: 'Have to give your life' to reach final
content: Mikel Arteta has said Arsenal need to be ready to give their life to reach the Champions League final.

title: Kane targets trophy 'number two' after title win
content: England striker Harry Kane said it feels sweet to finally end his career-long trophy drought after securing the Bundesliga title with Bayern Munich

title: Mourinho silent on future as Fener title hopes fade
content: José Mourinho refused to confirm whether he will remain at Fenerbahce next season after Sunday's defeat to Besiktas left them adrift in the title race.

title: Racing's Borges gets 3-match ban for ref push
content: Racing Louisville FC midfielder Ary Borges has been suspended for an additional three matches for pushing the center referee after a recent match.

title: Kroos: Pedri 'more important' to Barça than Yamal
content: Former Real Madrid player Toni Kroos believes Barcelona's Pedri is the best midfielder in the world and more important to his team than Lamine Yamal, Robert Lewandowski and Raphinha.

title: Mac Allister: Liverpool 'just getting started'
content: Liverpool midfielder Alexis Mac Allister hopes winning the Premier League title this season is "just the beginning of something great."
